channel.title: Setting player rights for the command ::bank ----seems simple :(

item.title: Setting player rights for the command ::bank ----seems simple :(
item.dc:creator: @lasthope lasthope
item.description:
@lasthope wrote:

I want to change it to admin only because the whole reason most of the skills take time to level is because a player only has 28 inventory spaces to use. If they have accesss to the bank the can just stand and mine all day long and get ridculous amonunts of ore whereas if they dont it will take that little bit longer making it more of a sense of achievement wen they actually get somewhere.

Read full topic

item.description:
@One_Night_Stand wrote:

lasthope:

i have tried everything you have all suggested and i have to say i was amazed at how fast everyone replied i only went t brush my teeth came back and people had allready posted. is it possible for me to send someone the client.java file so they can have a look to see where i messed up? thankyou so much for all you help everyone

Yeah you can put it as a .rar folder. Yep, I give what I never receive. Everytime I post a question, no answer at all…

item.title: Setting player rights for the command ::bank ----seems simple :(
item.dc:creator: @One_Night_Stand One Night Stand
item.description:
@One_Night_Stand wrote:

mrdek11:

Also, how would editing one command mess up the end of the void?

Not the void, it would mix with the rest of the commands because there’s no closing bracket.
Hmmm, you may be right. We should start a development team.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting player rights for the command ::bank ----seems simple :(

item.title: Setting player rights for the command ::bank ----seems simple :(
item.dc:creator: @mrdek11 mrdek11
item.description:
@mrdek11 wrote:

You don’t KNOW if there’s one below, usually there is one, but that could be the last of the line.
Also, how would editing one command mess up the end of the void?
If it is the command missing a bracket, adding one to the bottom would make the void ignore the rest of the commands between bank and the end, which could be fatal.

Check and see if there is a } between the end of the bank command and before the next if begins.

Read full topic

item.description:

Dude for an else command under bank there’s another one so you don’t close it off with a bracket…
And when its that case, you get a class, interface, or enum expected error with 100 of them.
But, IDK, I guess try it.

item.title: Setting player rights for the command ::bank ----seems simple :(
item.dc:creator: @lasthope lasthope
item.description:
@lasthope wrote:

i have been trying to set the player rights for the command ::bank so that only mods and admins can use this command. for my source 0=player 1=mod 2=admin i thought the easiest way to do this would be simply to cut this

} else if (command.startsWith("bank")) { openUpBank();
out of the client.java where it was under public commands and into admin command section i then used my complier but have come across this error
client.java:4331: illegal start of expression } public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

i have also tried adding player rights to the command itself but it doesnt seem to work. can anyone help me please??

Read full topic
item.source: Setting player rights for the command ::bank ----seems simple :(
